title: Faculty advisor

A faculty advisor is a professor assigned to students of a department (obsessionally different for 4-yr B.Tech and 5-yr Dual degree students). A Faculty advisor acts as a guardian for students assigned to them. They function as a gateway between the student community and the faculty community. Some of the roles a FacAd (Faculty Advisor) plays are:
• The faculty advisor approves the student registration at the start of each semester.
• Conducting the B.Tech project assignment.
• Keep a tab on academically weak students.
• Assisting students in choosing an appropriate area of interest.
